title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 February 2017 - XWiki
content:

08:49 <vmassol> sdumitriu: good morning. In case you have some time, some users have reported that http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Tooltip+Macro is not working anymore (see comment on that page). I see you're one of the authors ;)

10:54 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki

11:10 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki

13:10 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
13:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'll handle the upgrade to htmlcleaner 2.19, I need to change some stuff in our code  
13:20 <vmassol> creating jira  
13:25 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok, I usually don't touch htmlcleaner anyway :) last time it was gdelhumeau I think  
13:34 <gdelhumeau> I've received some emaisl recently about htmlcleaner  
13:34 <gdelhumeau> it seems they are fixing bugs that I have filled  
13:37 <vmassol> ah cool can you add them to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-1164 gdelhumeau?  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: done  
14:42 <vmassol> thx  
14:44 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: do we have a jira issue in xwiki for https://sourceforge.net/p/htmlcleaner/bugs/164/ ?  
14:45 <gdelhumeau> I have removed it from the comment  
14:45 <gdelhumeau> the fact is "font" is not a valid tag in html5  
14:45 <vmassol> I know but my question is whether we have a jira issue for whatever you wanted to do in xwiki?  
14:46 <gdelhumeau> I think I've implemented my use-case differently  
14:46 <vmassol> "I have removed it from the comment" not sure what you're referring to  
14:46 <gdelhumeau> for 166: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-901  
14:46 <vmassol> ok thx  
14:46 <vmassol> so 164 is not needed anymore ,cool  
14:47 <gdelhumeau> for 164 it was: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-825  
14:48 <vmassol> ok thx  
14:53 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
14:59 <ol-ow2> Hi, i'm looking for an JSON RPC java client to use with xwiki (could be called by groovy to communicate with LDAP -- read / write -- for example). There are lot of clients..I've no idea which is the better choice, and no idea about prerequises. Any idea ? mflorea, tmortagne, vmassol gdelhumeau  
15:02 <ol-ow2> erratum: to communicate with Fusion Directory (not LDAP)  
15:05 <vmassol> hmmm trying to figure out where the mail went for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/syntax-markdown/job/master/28/console  
15:05 <vmassol> it did say that it sent me an email but I haven't received it  
15:06 <vmassol> btw not very nice that it's printing my email address :)  
15:08 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:14 <gdelhumeau> ol-ow2: you mean a lib that you could use in XWiki  
15:14 <gdelhumeau> ?  
15:15 <ol-ow2> i guess yes, but i'm not sure :)  
15:15 <gdelhumeau> I know we have some low-level stuff, see an example: http://snippets.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LDAP+Query  
15:15 <ol-ow2> sorry, not LDAP  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> now if you want something more specific to Fusion Directory, I can't help you  
15:16 <ol-ow2> i'made a mistake previously  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> is Fusion Directory based on LDAP?  
15:16 <ol-ow2> i need to communicate with RPC serveur  
15:16 <ol-ow2> Fusion Directory called the LDAP  
15:16 <vmassol> ol-ow2: no idea  
15:16 <gdelhumeau> ok se we forget about the ldap thing  
15:16 <vmassol> any java lib will work  
15:16 <ol-ow2> but to communicate with FD, we need use an json RPC Client  
15:17 <vmassol> it's simple in groovy  
15:17 <ol-ow2> an example vmassol ?  
15:17 <vmassol> looks simple  
15:17 <vmassol> no  
15:17 <vmassol> just googled and saw several examples  
15:17 <vmassol> they looked simple  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> it looks like using apache http client, no?  
15:17 <ol-ow2> and several json client  
15:18 <gdelhumeau> then you can use ObjectMapper (from Jackson) to parse your JSON  
15:19 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: no need  
15:19 <vmassol> the groovy slurper is good for this  
15:19 <vmassol> much simpler  
15:19 <vmassol> \*groovy json slurper  
15:22 <ol-ow2> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XML-RPC+Integration i find this  
15:22 <ol-ow2> but it's XML  
15:23 <ol-ow2> i guess i need the same but in json  
15:23 <ol-ow2> using json format  
15:23 <vmassol> there are plenty of json examples on e.x.o  
15:24 <vmassol> check the groovy tag in the cloud  
15:25 <vmassol> ol-ow2: you should check in http://snippets.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/  
15:25 <vmassol> (and not on e.x.o)  
15:26 <vmassol> some ex here: http://snippets.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/JIRA+REST+Integration  
15:27 <ol-ow2> ok, i understand about xlm <=> json example (thanks)  
15:32 <ol-ow2> that's mean, i need use groovySlurper to transform the request/reply of xml RPC client ?  
15:33 <ol-ow2> i'm a bit lost here  
15:34 <ol-ow2> FD expect to receive json via RPC protocol from xwiki  
15:36 <ol-ow2> and xwiki expect to receive XML via RPC protocol from FD  
15:38 <tmortagne> not sure what you are talking about XML  
15:39 <tmortagne> isn't the subject JSON RPC  
15:39 <tmortagne> the example vmassol gave you are way to read JSON input in Groovy  
15:39 <ol-ow2> [15:22:30] <ol-ow2> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XML-RPC+Integration i find this  
15:39 <ol-ow2> ok for read  
15:39 <tmortagne> forget about http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XML-RPC+Integration, this is a XWiki API  
15:39 <ol-ow2> but i need read ans also write  
15:40 <tmortagne> not some generic XML RPC tool you would used in a script  
15:40 <tmortagne> to summarize XWiki does not provide you with anything to read/write JSON, you will have to use standard Groovy tools  
15:40 <tmortagne> I know there is one to read but pretty sure the one to write is not far  
15:42 <ol-ow2> ok, :) i understood  
15:43 <ol-ow2> i will make some tests  
15:44 <ol-ow2> and many thanks for your helps, and showing me the way
